title: Somehow 10 bans doesn't seem like nearly enough anymore

replies.body:
Doesn't help that they literally put off giving us 10 bans for so long that we probably needed a few more by the time we even got it.
And then they tried to do this half-assed shit where both teams ban blind, to try and cause overlap and steal one of our bans back from us. Because Riot was so butthurt about giving us 10 bans and so against us being able to ban their 'fun' champions every game.
To paraphrase "we're doing this because we're afraid some champions, cough yasuo will become perma banned so we'll do some work to help make him more tolerable"
which is funny because yasuo actually achieved a ban rate HIGHER than 100% multiple times XD

> [{quoted}](name=KrakenKnight,realm=OCE,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=Tc9eaAwc,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2018-10-13T07:52:34.348+0000)
>
> To paraphrase "we're doing this because we're afraid some champions, cough yasuo will become perma banned so we'll do some work to help make him more tolerable"

Next half year of patch notes-

Riot: Everyone looks fine!

Riot: ...

Riot: Actually Yasuo needs a *buff*.
Maybe they should ust balance his ass?
He's a hated design, that doesn't make him unbalanced.

His design is unbalanced because in order for his design to be balanced they have to reduce all of the stuff he has to around 0.25 second effects (knock up maybe 0.75 for his passive shield and 2 for his W) and not more than a 110 shield just to balance out him having 50% more crit 10% less crit damage isnt hardly enough to balance that
It's just that his passive is so strong. Double your crit chance? So you're telling me I don't need a second crit item to be 100% So I can have way may more damage now?

> [{quoted}](name=Slythrin Umbreon,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=Tc9eaAwc,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2018-10-13T03:40:40.112+0000)
>
> Doesn't help that they literally put off giving us 10 bans for so long that we probably needed a few more by the time we even got it.
> And then they tried to do this half-assed shit where both teams ban blind, to try and cause overlap and steal one of our bans back from us. Because Riot was so butthurt about giving us 10 bans and so against us being able to ban their 'fun' champions every game.

Blind ban is dumb.
What is a different solution that doesn't take forever?

> [{quoted}](name=Scuttle,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=Tc9eaAwc,comment-id=000000010000,timestamp=2018-10-13T20:16:41.754+0000)
>
> What is a different solution that doesn't take forever?

Similar to pick phase. I believe its feasible to reduce the time given for other thing such as champ select, runes  select and the time to show the champ wanted. All of those could be divided by two easily.

exactly. When u are forced to not Ban your counter,  cos some champs are so annoying tp deal,it's even worse.
it's like some champs dont have a REAL counterpick, dont u think?
_Glances at every CertainlyT champion._

...I mean, Yas and Zoe have some really shit matchups. Darius and Zyra have been reworked and have their fair share of weaknesses before and after then. Thresh is the only one who doesn't have a true counter but this isn't saying much since he's a generalist in Bot lane, where the 2v2 interactions take precedence over 1 on 1 counters.

Say what you want about CT champs but Yasuo mains cringe at Malzahar and Annie for a reason.

well, all of CT's champs are generalists and all have had their problems

Thresh was so powerful that he was the #1 support pick for 2 years before he was nerfed down to the other supports' levels

zyra was apparently a very oppressive champion when she came out but I was not here for that

yasuo would be kassadin levels of ban if he were released in season 3 or earlier where he could stop EVERY skillshot or marksman in the game

zoe can do absolutely everything and punishes you by effectively removing your summoner spells and items while getting free use of them herself from minion drops.  She is also the only champion that can drop multiple full damage ignites onto a single opponent.  The only thing she does not have is mobility without consequence(as her ult springs her back, but you could also say that it allows her to engage without consequence and extends her effective range by about 500)

#one of the main problems with CT is that he does not design EVERY champion, so those that he does design have advantages over others that can not be matched

When your counter has _clones_ lol. Im sure riot planned this ahead of time to render bans null. People dont like playing vs assassins with poke that _AlWaYs_ have an escape ability. Thats a natural thing that riot will probably never get.
{{champion:141}} This guy always ints and trolls in my team and on the enemy team he wins 1vs9...........
xD Kayn is the new Vayne.
You mean Yasuo? xD

Let me introduce you to the wonderful sport of Vaynespotting, my friend.

https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/memes/4Ig3eAGo-bring-back-vaynespotting

It's almost like people forgot to mention {{champion:142}}  or {{champion:7}}  coz unless most of the champions listed before, they have to land skillshots on a regular basis , so there playrate is lower xD 
Seriously tho, AD champions have had overtuned kits for quite a while now (4-5 seasons) I just love the fact that players just tend to be worse when they're playing strong champions, it's somehow ridiculous, I mean {{champion:141}}  for example can't miss unless he really fucks up hard since his kit is so simple, yet the proportion of ridiculously bad kayn players is through the roof x)
who still bans zoe with her 46% winrate?
Who still thinks a bad winrate means a champion is bad? or not worth a ban for that matter.

what else does it mean? 

Champion is winning less games ergo champion is weak/bad. Atleast if you look at the majority of players. Sure there are some players that can play her somewhat good and compensate that weakness, but I doubt you will see them in your games and wasting a ban for this matter when there are better picks just seems weird.

well trynd was worth a ban at low levels even while he was bad at highers but thats not really the same deal as zoe so yea i agree with you

people need to stop whining about zoe and all heros in general
Outrageous range beats LeBlanc. Try{{champion:101}} . poke her and last hit at the same time the entire laneing phase. Max range q obliterates ;)

> [{quoted}](name=Auccuatt,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=Tc9eaAwc,comment-id=0003,timestamp=2018-10-13T07:28:32.559+0000)
>
> The sad part is, all of those are AD champions.
> 
> {{sticker:zombie-brand-facepalm}}
> 
> Edit: I looked at it right to left, {{champion:84}} is the only exception here.

Well all the Yi's i have seen lately seem to do more true damage than AD damage, doesn't that make him non-AD.
 {{sticker:sg-ezreal}}

> [{quoted}](name=Auccuatt,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=Tc9eaAwc,comment-id=0003,timestamp=2018-10-13T07:28:32.559+0000)

> 
> {{sticker:zombie-brand-facepalm}}
> 
> Edit: I looked at it right to left, {{champion:84}} is the only exception here.

ad akali is a thing
You forgot {{champion:105}}
Xayah?
it's almost like you can't ban out everything that poses a threat to you because you want to autowin your lane. take a lap.

> [{quoted}](name=Cobalt Entity,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=Tc9eaAwc,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2018-10-13T06:14:46.918+0000)
>
> it's almost like you can't ban out everything that poses a threat to you because you want to autowin your lane. take a lap.

Instead of learning how to play better, we just want to ban out everything that requires some level of brain power to play against.

> [{quoted}](name=mikemcparty,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=Tc9eaAwc,comment-id=00020001,timestamp=2018-10-13T11:52:05.297+0000)
>
> Instead of learning how to play better, we just want to ban out everything that requires some level of brain power to play against.

So much brains required to literally oneshotting enemy adc as {{champion:141}}

> [{quoted}](name=PopcornBunni,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=Tc9eaAwc,comment-id=,timestamp=2018-10-13T02:03:34.178+0000)
>
> The game has so much shit that&#039;s unenjoyable cancer 
> 
> {{champion:84}} {{champion:164}} {{champion:104}} {{champion:145}} {{champion:202}} {{champion:24}} {{champion:39}} {{champion:141}} {{champion:121}} {{champion:236}} {{champion:11}} {{champion:555}} {{champion:14}} {{champion:91}} {{champion:6}} {{champion:498}} {{champion:238}} {{champion:157}} 
> 
> 

Half champions here need a total rework or directly shouldn't have been designed that way in the first place.

But you know: the balance team is rubbish and some champion designers are allowed to do whatever thing comes to their minds.
The game could be so much more fun  if you delete/ban all champs you said...
Since when are Kayn, Urgot and Zed cancer? Or Camille for that matter? I understand Yi or Jhin or Kai'Sa but those guys?

?????????????

Since when has Zed not been cancer??

> [{quoted}](name=LightTrack,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=Tc9eaAwc,comment-id=0016,timestamp=2018-10-13T22:32:23.972+0000)
>
> Since when are Kayn, Urgot and Zed cancer? Or Camille for that matter? I understand Yi or Jhin or Kai'Sa but those guys?

Anything that requires me to think more than ''dodge skillshots'' is cancer - boards logic.

10 bans is enough
the problem is they way they implement them

Ignoring that people ban the one weird champion that beat them last game isntead of real team issues,
its that people can ban the same champion, potentially making 10 bans only 5

and even worse is that people can choose to ban NOBODY, potentially making it even lower than 5

i think it would be much better to go back to the old captain format where one person controls the bans
I pity anyone that one tricks a champion and then gets that champ banned for a week straight.

Personal Question , why didn't you put {{champion:103}} in your list? tho it annoys me as someone who mains to see a lot of hate on her
But I'm wondering why didn't you put here there

> [{quoted}](name=Noor Sakata,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=Tc9eaAwc,comment-id=0018,timestamp=2018-10-14T01:57:06.247+0000)
>
> Personal Question , why didn't you put {{champion:103}} in your list? tho it annoys me as someone who mains to see a lot of hate on her
> But I'm wondering why didn't you put here there

Probably because Ahri still has very clear cut weakness in her kit and is only truly annoying when the meta shifts to safe mid picks. Her mana costs are pretty high during the laning phase and if you whiff her E, you are pretty much useless if your R is down. 

Whereas majority of the champions listed above have some sort of additional "oh shit I dun goffed" button even in worst case scenarios.

High Mana costs? Her Q costs 65-85 mana based on rank whilst her W and E cost 40 and 70 respectively. Unless your using Q off cd you shouldn't be running out of mana anytime soon considering her mana costs are much lower then champions like Lux, Orianna or Galio who actually have mana problems until lost chapter. And she's up there for the safest laning phase champion in the game once she hits 6. Triple Dash, MS passive which only requires 2 ability hits (aka just her Q) and a 1.4sec charm at rank 1. Her ulti is the definition of an "oh shit i dun goofed" button since majority of the time she is going to have 1 or 2 charges still up after going in and putting herself in a bad situation.

> [{quoted}](name=Shigure,realm=OCE,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=Tc9eaAwc,comment-id=001800000000,timestamp=2018-10-14T23:03:21.956+0000)
>
> High Mana costs? Her Q costs 65-85 mana based on rank whilst her W and E cost 40 and 70 respectively. Unless your using Q off cd you shouldn't be running out of mana anytime soon considering her mana costs are much lower then champions like Lux, Orianna or Galio who actually have mana problems until lost chapter. And she's up there for the safest laning phase champion in the game once she hits 6. Triple Dash, MS passive which only requires 2 ability hits (aka just her Q) and a 1.4sec charm at rank 1. Her ulti is the definition of an "oh shit i dun goofed" button since majority of the time she is going to have 1 or 2 charges still up after going in and putting herself in a bad situation.

It's rather high for the low mana pool she got, considering it's a rather basic skillshot damage ability only. Lux and Orianna got quite a lot of utility in their abilities. Not that it means anything. They could all use a mana buff. 

Also, it's like you didn't even read anything I wrote. If her R is down, she is out of luck in actually doing much. Look at the above listed champions. Majority of them has an additional form of mobility or safeguard even if they used up their ult.

and you could say the same for a large portion of the champions listed above if their main mobility spell is down. The only one's up there i can agree with is Zed, Talon, Akali and Kha who is situational (Kha needs to reset for an escape).  Ahri should have moments of vulnerability where she can be ganked or caught since she has 3 dashes on a fairly short CD (which goes down as far as 44sec late game). And it's not like she can't do anything when her ults down 20% ms on a 9sec cd with a 1.4 sec charm is plenty to protect yourself when your ult's down. A large portion of mid laners only have 1 CC ability and no Mobility spell to protect themselves with (Lux, Veigar, Syndra, Vel'Koz to name a few).

> [{quoted}](name=Shigure,realm=OCE,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=Tc9eaAwc,comment-id=00180000000000000000,timestamp=2018-10-15T01:07:20.316+0000)
>
> and you could say the same for a large portion of the champions listed above if their main mobility spell is down. The only one's up there i can agree with is Zed, Talon and Kha who is situational (Kha needs to reset for an escape).  Ahri should have moments of vulnerability where she can be ganked or caught since she has 3 dashes on a fairly short CD (which goes down as far as 44sec late game). And it's not like she can't do anything when her ults down 20% ms on a 9sec cd with a 1.4 sec charm is plenty to protect yourself when your ult's down. A large portion of mid laners only have 1 CC ability and no Mobility spell to protect themselves with (Lux, Veigar, Syndra, Vel'Koz to name a few).

Yeah...no. Ahri's mobility is tied to her R, which has your standard cooldown. Her passive relies on actually hitting her enemies x2, adding on skill cap, and making it very unlikely to be used all the time either. She burns her R and she's screwed. Charm's skillshot hitbox is small as well. Whiff it and you're doubly screwed. Meanwhile, other non AP champions who has mobility + defense don't need to aim.  And to be fair, with a lot of mobility in this game, if she is caught without her ult, she's dead meat anyways, even with her E. 

Meanwhile, the ones listed above. 

More than 1 mobility skill outside of ult: 
Akali: W, E, and R.
Graves: E, and R
Kaisa: E and R
Kayn: Q and E
Kha'Zix: E and R
Yi: Q and R
Pike: W, E, and R
Talon: Q, E, R
Zed: W and R

The others have 1 mobility + a form of shield or other type of non-skillshot defense:
Camille: E and Passive
Irelia: Q and W/E
Yasuo: Passive, W, E, R 
Jax: Q and E/R

Only 3 on there either has 1 type of mobility or none:
Xayah: R
Sion: R
Jhin: Reload passive

Yeh her passive is real hard to proc... requiring only 2 hits from 3 abilities which hit multiple times (2x on Q, 3X on W, 3x on R)  2 of them prioritising champions, and the one which isn't a multi-hit almost guaranteeing another ability will hit to proc it anyway. It's almost impossible for Ahri not to proc it in a trade or when ganked as she simply needs to press W and/or Q to proc it. Charms hit-box is standard hit-box and as i said as a champion with a triple dash she should be vulnerable when her mobility spell is down and she misses her CC.

Ok onto the champs you listed.

You specified more then 1 mobility skill without ult then listed Ult as the 2nd mobility spell for half of them so can ignore Graves,Kai'sa, Kha'Zix, Yi, Zed for the sake of this argument (and Kayn doesn't count to begin with since he uses both in his engage and both are horrid forms of escape). The rest i can agree with, Talon and Akali are too safe and Pyke is getting nerfed next patch specifically because of how easily he escapes once in with the tank build however he also uses all of the above for engage so eh goes either way. You also have to factor in that majority of these are melee and have to go into melee range to do anything so are much more risky then a champ that stays at 550+ range whenever possible.

For the 1 mobility + shield or non skill-shot defense you can add Ahri to that since she gets a heal from her Q as that's a form of sustain same as a shield. 

Honestly it seems like your argument is Ahri is fair because she is vulnerable when her mobility spell is down whilst all these champs are not whilst almost all of them are in a much riskier situation assuming their mobility spell is down and have a much weaker form of mobility/escape then Ahri and her triple dashes in the first place.

This is why you should main support.

Yeah of course we can't always help you on mid or top but in team fights these guys and gals, Taric, Nami, Lulu, Thresh, Sona, Janna, Soraka Alistar are actually good at disengaging those cancerous champions or saving your ass.
